problem_text:
(Well-known problem). Is it true that if there exist two non-isomorphic groups with the given set of orders of the elements, then there are infinitely many groups with this set of orders of the elements?
S. A. Syskin
answer: No, it is not (V. D. Mazurov, Algebra and Logic, 33, no. 1 (1994), 49–55).
